files.description: Defines the machine-readable JSON Schema for Claim Cards including required metadata, versioning, provenance, and correction history fields.
Provides the human-friendly Markdown Claim Card template with embedded YAML front matter aligned to the schema and containing all mandatory fields.
Documents the end-to-end workflow for creating Claim Cards, validating them, running the 3-claim pilot, and logging failure modes and corrections.

Implements a CLI-capable validator that loads Claim Card YAML/JSON, validates against the schema, and emits structured failure-mode logs (missing metadata, version ambiguity, correction history issues).
Parses Markdown Claim Cards with YAML front matter into normalized JSON objects suitable for schema validation and pilot logging.
Runs the 3-claim pilot by validating three sample Claim Cards, capturing validation outcomes, and writing a consolidated failure-mode report.
Defines canonical failure-mode codes, detection rules, and helper routines to aggregate and summarize pilot issues consistently.
Sample Claim Card #1 used in the 3-claim pilot containing a realistic claim and metadata to exercise validation and provenance requirements.
Sample Claim Card #2 used in the 3-claim pilot intentionally containing version/provenance ambiguity to validate detection and logging.
Sample Claim Card #3 used in the 3-claim pilot intentionally containing correction history gaps to validate detection and logging.
Stores the machine-readable pilot run log as JSON Lines capturing per-claim validation results, detected failure modes, and suggested remediations.
